summary: Internal email chain among US Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff discussing a court-ordered declaration to explain disparities in discovery and counsel access between Ghislaine Maxwell (detained at MDC) and Justin Rivera (detained at MCC). The document details differences in housing, facility resources, and case circumstances that justify the varying accommodations.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Accused in a sex trafficking case, detained at MDC in protective custody, receiving extensive discovery and counsel access accommodations.

persons.name: Justin Rivera
persons.context: Charged with sex trafficking conspiracy, detained at MCC in general population, receiving more limited discovery and counsel access compared to Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Engelmayer
persons.context: Presiding over United States v. Rivera et al., raised concerns about disparities in access between Maxwell and Rivera, and ordered a declaration from BOP.

persons.name: Bhaskaran
persons.context: Author of the initial email bringing the issue to attention, summarizing the case background and court orders.

connections.description: Both are defendants in federal sex trafficking cases, but their treatment regarding discovery and counsel access is being compared by the court, with Maxwell receiving superior accommodations.
Judge Engelmayer is presiding over Rivera's case and has expressed frustration with MCC's accommodations, ordering explanations for disparities.
Bhaskaran, as an AUSA, is communicating the judge's request for a BOP declaration to internal colleagues.

events.title: Declaration Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the US Attorney's Office to submit a declaration from BOP explaining disparities in access between Maxwell and Rivera.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Justin Rivera
events.description: Rivera's trial was expected to start on this date (though originally scheduled for April 2019).

events.title: New Counsel Appointed for Rivera
events.description: Justin Rivera had new counsel appointed due to an irreconcilable breakdown with former counsel.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was housed in protective custody at MDC with sole access to a room for computer/phone use ~13 hours/day, while Justin Rivera was in general population at MCC sharing VTC room with ~80 other inmates.
Maxwell's case had 'multiple times more discovery' than Rivera's, justifying greater electronic access needs.
The MCC began leaving a laptop with Rivera all day for charging only at night, effectively matching Maxwell's electronic discovery access hours.
Judge Engelmayer described the disparity in access as 'strikingly different' with 'terrible' optics, and defense counsel suggested differential treatment based on race, gender, and class.
The US Attorney's Office attributed disparities to specific housing situations, facility resources, and case-specific requests from lawyers, not discriminatory intent.
